description: APPLICATION FOR GRANTING PIZZERIA KIOSK PERMANENT FIXTURE STATUS.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: [24004-004, 24004-003, 24004-001]
Condition : 3 - Hours of Use - The use hereby permitted shall operate only between the hours of 10:00am to 20:00pm on any day.
Condition : 4 - This site is in an area for planned public realm enhancements and is in close proximity to street trees. As such, the hereby approved pizza kiosk must be re-sited if requested by Merton Council to allow for public realm/tree works to take place.

Reason: To allow for public realm/tree works to take place.
Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant -Approved Schemes
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to the delivery of sustainable development, by:
1. Providing a formal pre-application advice service, details to be found on Planning pre-application advice service on LBM's website
2. Providing written policies and guidance, which is available to view on LBM's website.
3. Where appropriate, negotiating amendments to secure a positive decision.
4. Determining applications in a timely manner including providing a fast track service, details to be found on Get a quicker planning decision on LBM's website.

In this instance:
i) The application was acceptable as submitted, and approved with an agreed determination date.
Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE
You are advised to contact the Council's Highways team on 020 8545 3700 before undertaking any works within the Public Highway to obtain the necessary approvals and/or licences. Please be advised that there is a further charge for this work. If your application falls within a Controlled Parking Zone this has further costs involved and can delay the application by 6 to 12 months.
Condition : 7 - The applicant is advised that this consent is planning permission only and the site is Council land and the applicant must therefore obtain all relevant licences from the Council requried in order to operate from the site.
